resources.string: No Account yet? Sign Up here!
Already have an Account? Sign In here!

"Inflation rate can be defined as a general rise in the price of goods and service.

 If the annual inflation rate is 20%, that means prices will on average,increase by 20% in a year.

 Inflation reduces the purchasing power of your money.

Needless to say, if the annual inflation rate is 0%, that means price will,on average, remain the same."

Example 1 : 
Inflation rate = 100%

Today: You have $1,000
- A basket of goods and service cost $500.
- You can buy 2 baskets.
- A bank pays 100% interest.
- Invest $1000 and get $2000 next year.



After 1 year : You have $2,000
- A basket of goods cost $1,000 
- You can buy 2 baskets of goods and services!
